name: Horse Graveyard (2012)
description:
A collection of North Americana-flavored songs filled with western characters I've known. You'll meet Sandy Bob, Bad Becky, Queen Patricia, Sugar Bank Hank, Cowboy Moses, and others. Recorded at Dub Narcotic Studio by Bob Schwenkler, it features guitar, bass, fiddle, pedal steel, drums, piano, cello, back-up vocals, and trombone.  It's my first release on Bicycle Records.

Tracklist

1. Johnny Thurman
2. Bad Becky
3. Sandy Bob
4. Horse Graveyard
5. Queen Patricia
6. Go Easy on Me Boss (My Heart is Breakin')
7. Miller Killer
8. I Ride an Old Paint
9. Typical
10. Damascus
11. When I Love
12. Sugar Bank Hank

artists.name: Chris Sand aka "Sandman the Rappin' Cowboy"

name: Chemicals in the Wheat (2010)
description: Dystopic visions illuminating Chris Sand's strangest hour. Lush aural production by Shawn "Nerviz" Parke on nine songs and Carl Dexter on two others. Missoula Independent calls it "a delightful mixture of indie folk, Americana and country with just a dose of hip-hop flavor . . . a perfect platform for Sand's impressively flexible writing." Gorgeous cover artwork by Nikki McClure. Please visit nikkimcclure.com! 1. Corpse 2. Michael Jackson 3. Strange Medicine 4. All the Things I Done Wrong 5. Day's Wages 6. Buddha Chant 7. Pegasus 8. Mister, I Can't Save Your Daughter 9. O, Tsunami 10. Your Mind is Mine 11. The Illness You may hear song samples and/or download this album at: http://www.amazon.com/Chemicals-in-the-Wheat-Explicit/dp/B0062SF996

artists.name: Chris Sand aka "Sandman the Rappin' Cowboy"

name: Eleven Super Old-School Hip Hop Tapes + BOOMBOX!
description: 1. Grandmaster Flash & the Furious Five: The Message (1982) 2. RUN-D.M.C. (1984) - Ranked #242 on Rolling Stone magazine's list of the 500 greatest albums of all time. 3. LL Cool J: Radio (1985) Ranked #470 on Rolling Stone magazine's list of the 500 greatest albums of all time. I can't begin to tell you how much just these three masterpieces have influenced my music and life. They've also massively influenced world music and culture. So have these: 4. Kool Moe Dee: How Ya Like Me Now? (1987) The title track is ranked #31 on VH1s 100 Greatest Hip Hop Songs. 5. Eric B. & Rakim: Paid in Full (1987) Ranked #227 on Rolling Stone magazine's list of the 500 greatest albums of all time. 6. N.W.A.: Straight Outta Compton (1988) Ranked #144 on Rolling Stone magazine's list of the 500 greatest albums of all time. 7. Big Daddy Kane: Long Live the Kane (1988) One of the most influential hip hop albums from the Golden Era of Hip Hop by one of the greatest MCs. 8. The 2 Live Crew: As Nasty as They Wanna Be / Double LP (1989) The first album in history to be deemed legally obscene. 9. BREAKDANCE (1984) Strange breakdance "music" from real-estate agent Larry Wolff & the Streetbeaters. 10. Rapper's Delight & Other Old School Favorites (features monster hits such as Newcleus' "Jam On It" and "Rapper's Delight" by Sugarhill Gang). 1979-1984. 11. West Coast Rap: The First Dynasty, Vol. 1 (features, among others, early Ice T, Egyptian Lover, and Disco Daddy & Captain Rapp). Early '80s. INCLUDED: Durabrand Radio Cassette Player (see image 1). Runs on batteries or electricity.

name: Until the End of Time (2000)
description: "This crazy CD will rock you." The Olympian Original, irresistible hip-hop lyrics with the organic beatbox sounds of Camo Davi. 1. Until The End Of Time 2. Are We Gonna Rock It?! 3. When The Cyclone Struck 4. 2 Lips And A Lot O' Verb 5. Persian Den Of Sin 6. Shy Girl 7. 64 Rambler 8. The Prophet 9. Olympia's The Capitol (Of Rock And Roll) 10. Out Of Place 11. New Railroad Blues 12. All That I Got 13. Untitled

name: Love's Hangover Sale (1997)
description: A nostalgic nod to Sand's hole-diggin' youth. ". . . from the same dusty world Woody Guthrie wrote about, without being mired in the dust of Guthrie's tradition" -- No Depression, 1998 1. Love's Hangover Sale 2. The Goodnight-Loving Trail 3. You Ain't a Real Cowboy 4. Hole Digger 5. Thanks a Lot 6. Waiting on an Angel 7. Dear Grandma 8. M for Montana 9. Glory to Hale-Bopp 10. Columbiana 11. Tractor Pull 12. Saddle Bum 13. Pistol Packin' Papa 14. Two Key-Chains

name: Return to the Blackhole of Outerspace (2006)
description:
"An intense journey beyond the farthest reaches of psychedelic hip-hop awaits you.  The musical answer to a Hunter S. Thompson road trip into the dark side of the American psyche." -Crunks Not Dead Records.

Visit the sexual, violent, yet strangely hopeful wild west of Chris Sand's intergalactic nerve-center. Words by Sand, beats by Timezone LaFontaine.

1. Return
2. Sandpan's Delight
3. Pillowcases
4. Bragtalk 1
5. Highwayman
6. Tiny Spy Camera
7. Twice?!
8. Gateway Cock
9. Pony
10. Galahad
11. Bragtalk 2
12. Time Is Running Out
13. Jihad
14. Cloudsplitter
15. Monday Morning
16. What's Wrong?
17. Escape

name: The Long Walk Home (2002)
description: "Sandman is our troubadour for the 21st century." Punk Planet Post 9/11 break-up songs, mostly folk. Humor and pain in a saddle-bum stew.  Reissue of Sand's biggest seller to date. 1. The Cowboy's Life is a Very Dreary Life 2. Nothin' To Say 3. Hit The Road 4. Imaginary World 5. Ol' King Kong 6. I Got My Email Cut Off 7. Radio Works Fine 8. Gorilla 9. Hammer and Screw 10. Christ-bearer's Blues 11. Belmopan is Belmopan 12. Folk Legend (MLK)

name: Rough Notes from Otter Cove (2008)
description: Rustic and playful. Highly listenable lo-fi production by Froseph Kujawa. Includes a limited edition 24-page lyrics booklet, handset and pressed on a 130-year-old print machine. Tracklist 1. Crazy Animals 2. The Hermit 3. PO Box 7 4. Addie Paul 5. Artesian Lover 6. I Love Everyone 7. Natty Joy 8. Shelly The Sea Turtle 9. Wedding Song Man 10. Unabomber 11. End Of America

artists.name: Chris Sand aka "Sandman the Rappin' Cowboy"

name: Cat Skull / Bird Nest
description:
Cat skull with sweet fangs (see image 2) found in a barn that my dad and I were tearing down outside of Killdeer, ND. 

Nest found on Killdeer Mountain while on a walk.  Bird used horse hair to weave 90% of it--and then grass for the outside lining.

Round rock (pictured) <u>included</u>.

name: Roses & Cotton Pillow Case
description:
Lovingly thrifted pillow cases to *nap upon. 

VINTAGE COTTON, soft for your noggin!

*One magic dream GUARANTEED with purchase.

artists.name: Chris Sand aka "Sandman the Rappin' Cowboy"

name: SAND by Will James
description:
This is a story of a man and a horse. Both have "sand" - the gumption it takes to tackle the challenges of life head on. The setting is the Great Plains. The characters are cowboys and horses. The heart of this story is the hero's long duel with the horse, and how "the little grain of sand within him" starts to grow.

This classic western has forty stellar illustrations by the author.  It's about a greenhorn drunk trying to tame a mysterious wild stallion. 

Pages clean and intact.  Some scuffs on spine and corners.  Wear consistent with age.

Copyright, 1929
This edition, 1941

name: Truckin' On: Leather Billfold w/ Trucker Casette
description: Leather billfold with chain. On front a big rig! On back "Jim." Pristine vintage condition minus the white scuffs on back. A total of five pockets. Snaps and metal zipper to keep your pill-box & half-dollars safe and secure. Rugged enough for a woman or man. Included: Truckin' On: Various Artists Some of my favorite songs are on this tape . . . "Girl on the Billboard" (Del Reeves) "Giddyup-Go" (Red Sovine) "Eight More Miles to Louisville" (Grandpa Jones) "The Gear Jammer & the Hobo" (Red Sovine & Johnny Bond) "Truck Driver's Queen (Moore & Napier) Others by George Jones, Jimmy Martin, and Claude Gray!

name: Marijuana Bracelet (+ Unicorn Lighter & Utopia)
description: Hana made this pot-leaf bracelet by stringing 19 sterling silver-&-turquoise cannabis charms along a silver-toned metal chain. The chain features a lobster claw clasp for easy attachment. Each leaf is stamped "sterling" on the back and comes from the Neuens' Western Shop in Bismarck, ND. The owners--my relatives-- were unaware of the drug symbolism and sold them as maple leaf charms at $10 a pop. Dig it. Total length of bracelet: 7 inches. I bought the rainbow unicorn lighter at an antique store in Rocker, MT. It's well-constructed and lights up nicely. (Image 3.) Utopia, first published in 1516 by Sir Thomas More, has been viewed as a "philosophical romance, a traveler's tale, a treatise on political economy, a monument of European humanism--even as the first science-fiction story." I haven't read Utopia, but any novel that's 500 years old must be groovy. Sir Thomas More was canonised by the Catholic Church in 1886.

name: Crop Tops by "Sandman"
description: Crop tops, half shirts, belly shirts, cutoff shirts, tummy tops, whatever you call 'em--I've got 'em! New old-stock, i.e. vintage shirts that have never been worn. Gray cotton-blend fabric silk-screened with a brown or purple "Sandman." For men or women. Shirts marked XL, but I think they are closer to Large. Show off your abs and navel NOW.

artists.name: Chris Sand aka "Sandman the Rappin' Cowboy"

name: Beaver Skull / Bird Nest
description:
Beaver skull with yellowed incisors found while walking with Hana along Spring Creek on Killdeer Mountain in western North Dakota.  It had bits of hair and flesh on it, so Hana placed it on a large ant pile near the dam.  When we returned, two weeks later, the skull was completely clean.

The nest also comes from Killdeer Mountain.  I found it blowing along a trail while berry picking.  The inside lining is woven from dried grass.  The papery outer lining appears to be crafted from small bits of birch bark and other finely chewed wood fragments (similar to wasp nest).

Round rock (pictured) <u>included</u>.

name: Vintage Enamel Coffee Pot + Organic Gourmet Coffee
description:
"Wake up Jakob, day's a-breakin'!"

Roll out yore day with delicious Montana java served up in this handsome enamel coffee pot from the 1950s.  There are a couple chips in the paint on the lid, but besides that it's pristine.

The coffee is certified organic from my now hometown, Missoula.  Smells delicious!
